evidence.text: NOTICE OF VOLUNTARY DISMISSAL ... Plaintiff United States of America hereby dismisses the above-captioned case pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1). ... Frank v. Gaos, 586 U.S. 485, 492 (2019).

Notice of Voluntary Dismissal
Plaintiff United States of America hereby dismisses the above-captioned case pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1). The United States has determined not to proceed further in this matter.

extracted.value: Not Applicable

evidence.text: ORDER Upon consideration of the Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree filed by Plaintiff United States of America and Defendant City of Durham, North Carolina, and subject to final decision based on any objections, the Court finds that the terms of the proposed Consent Decree are fair, ... ORDERED that the Motion is GRANTED, and the Consent Decree is PROVISIONALLY ENTERED;

extracted.value: Court granted the Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree and provisionally entered the Consent Decree.

evidence.text: ORDER granting 10 Motion to Stay is GRANTED and that all case management deadlines, including the United States' deadline to serve the Summons and Complaint on the City of Durham, are stayed pending the courts resolution of the Parties' Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree. Signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 12/20/2024.

extracted.value: Court granted Motion 10 to Stay case management deadlines.

evidence.text: ORDER signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025, that the motion (Doc. 13 ) is GRANTED.

extracted.value: Court granted the Consent Motion to Exceed Word Limitation (Doc. 13).

evidence.text: ORDER that the motion 14 is GRANTED in that American Alliance for Equal Rights is granted leave to file its brief as amicus curiae as a separate document forthwith. The court reserves decision on whether the Alliance shall be granted leave to present argument at any future hearing. Signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025.

extracted.value: Court granted Motion 14 for leave to file amicus brief and granted leave to file amicus curiae brief.
